thread.title: High school girls tennis: Hinsdale Central defends state title, Lyons Township top-5 in team standings
thread.title_full: High school girls tennis: Hinsdale Central defends state title, Lyons Township top-5 in team standings

title: High school girls tennis: Hinsdale Central defends state title, Lyons Township top-5 in team standings
text:
High school girls tennis: Hinsdale Central defends state title, Lyons Township top-5 in team standings Published: Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015 10:03 p.m. CDT By SUBURBAN LIFE MEDIA 
BUFFALO GROVE â€“ Isabella Lorenzini won singles draw while Sandra Keta and Stephanie Dolehide finished tops in doubles and Danielle Burich and Erika Oku were fourth in doubles as Hinsdale Central's girls tennis team defended its state title. 
The Red Devils tallied 50 points to finish well clear of Stevenson (30 points), New Trier (27) and Lyons Township (25). 
Sophia Haleas compiled a 4-2 record in the tourney, winning twice in the singles main draw. 
Glenbard East's Kolie Allen made it to the quarterfinals of the singles draw and finished fifth overall. Allen's tourney run brought a 16th place finish for East; Allen was the Rams' only state qualifier. 
Lyons Township's Stefana Vasic and Lahari Yelamanchili placed fifth in doubles, finishing their tourney with a 6-1, 6-0 win against New Trier's Michelle Capone and Catherine MacKinnon. Teammate Jelly Bozovic was top-12 in singles, advancing to the consolation quarterfinals. Sophie Allison and Maggie 
Morris went 3-2 in doubles play. 
Glenbard West's Molly Rueth and Molly Hughes lost their first match, then won five straight before bowing out of the tourney. Teammate Caroline Maltby went 3-2 in singles play, winning twice in the main draw. 
Samantha Choi from Wheaton Warrenville South won three times in the singles main draw and went 4-2 in the tourney. Katya Shcherbyna went 3-2 in the tourney. 
York's Abby Brigman and Alex Hennessy compiled a 3-2 record in the doubles bracket, Julia Riddle and Claire Meyer were 2-2 in doubles and Maja Shaw won a match in the singles main draw. 
McKenna Byrne won twice in the singles main draw and went 2-2 in the tourney for Timothy Christian's best showing. Abygale Ahn won her first match. Danielle Beard and Maddie Monat won a doubles match, and Toni Paterno and Ellie Wiener played in the doubles bracket. 
Nazareth's Carlie Wilson and the doubles team of Julianna Petrovic and Mary Mullarkey each had 2-2 records at state. Julie Saladino in singles and Katie Swade and Lily Franko in doubles also represented the Roadrunners at state. 
Benet's Allison Bartley and Katie Telford won twice to start their tourney and finished with a 4-2 mark in the doubles draw. 
Ashley Mathews and Gabby Rabianski won a doubles match for Lemont, while teammate Grace Horky played in the singles draw. 
Wheaton Academy's Maisie Howland and Lily Bracy won a doubles consolation match. 
Wheaton North's Madeline Fidel won a singles match.
